WordPress

WordPress is a content management system (CMS) that gives it's users the ability to quickly and easily maintain a complex website. WordPress is open source software which means anyone can install it on their system and use it for FREE. WordPress often times gets confused with the WordPress blogging platform but its it's own tool that you can separately download.

How Popular Is WordPress?

WordPress has been the most popular way of creating a website for almost 15 years now. Around 40% of the websites on the entire internet are powered by WordPress. In this post I'll be talking about some of the main reasons that make WordPress the most popular content management system.

WordPress Is Easy To Use Especially For Beginners

One of the main reasons WordPress is the go to website solution for the internet community is because of it's intuitive user interface. The famous WordPress dashboard which contains menus on the left hand side to navigate throughout your websites backend make accomplishing simple tasks like creating pages or search engine optimization very simple for anyone to accomplish.

WordPress Plugins Make Adding Features To Your Website Easy

What is a WordPress plugin? WordPress Plugins are additional features that you can install into your build to add functionality to your website. These extra features that you can add with just a few simple clicks can help you do things like: Implement a form system that notifys of new submissions through email, add a login system that gives your users a customized experience when using your web application, add and manage an entire online store from the dashboard of your wordpress website.

WordPress Themes Make It Easy To Design

What are WordPress Themes? WordPress Themes very much like WordPress Plugins are additional pieces of code you can add to your website to improve it's appearance. WordPress Themes can give you professional Grade look to your website and save you a few hundred dollars in design work.

Theirs A Lot of Free WordPress Resources Online

One of the realities as a website owner you'll eventually run into are technical issues. As powerful and helpful as these communication tools are they can occasionally be a bit sensitive. The benefit of working with WordPress is that, due to its popularity, there are numerous tutorials available online to help you with almost any issue you're trying to troubleshoot or any feature you're trying to implement.

WordPress Makes Search Engine Optimization A Little Easier

One thing WordPress is notable for is Search Engine Optimization.

Things To Consider Before Choosing WordPress

While you'll generally hear nothing but good things about WordPress their are a few things you should consider before making a decision.

WordPress Security

One of the major downsides of WordPress is how 3rd party code get's constantly and casually inserted into your website. Don't get me wrong most plugins are safe but their is a security risk you take especially when you install 3rd party plugins into your WordPress website. Often times you'll see headlines bounding around that theirs a new security flaw in a certain plugins that just recks havoc on a website. A lot of these "too many chefs in the kitchen" some very obvious wholes start to become apparent with WordPress. The most glaring problem is the amount of 3rd party code you put into your website. WordPress users regularly have to stay on top of their updates due to malicious attacks from hackers who use 3rd party plugins to inject code into website.

WordPress Might Be Overkill

One important thing to consider before investing your hard earned money into a website is the price. With the convenance and ease of use that WordPress provides beginners it's literally a no brainer if you have the money and time, but if you're not looking to pay a couple hundred dollars a year for operational costs it's completely fine to look for an alternative solution.
